intro: Alaticaulia bryophila, commonly known as the slender-stemmed moss, is a rare and specialized bryophyte found in specific microhabitats. It belongs to the family Calypogeeaceae and is characterized by its delicate, elongated stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on rock surfaces or in crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are typically borne on short stalks near the base of the plant. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Alaticaulia bryophila is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental stability.
